html:
The San Mart?n Regional Government (Goresam), through its executing unit, the Alto Mayo Special Project (PEAM), continues to work to improve the Paitoja section, Moyobamba province and Garzayacu, Huallaga province, border area with the department of Amazon. An intervention that will benefit more than 3,000 residents and farmers, who will be able to better access consumer markets and other services.

In this regard, the president of Pro Carretera, Eloy Pena Jim?nez, said: "I am satisfied and happy to have the support of our local, provincial, regional authorities and all their technical team, because they give us the assurance that the works will keep moving forward, well, we have been fighting since 2018 presenting documents so that our trails can be traversed?, he said.

For his part, the manager of the PEAM, Luis V?ctor Elizarbe Ramos, indicated that, in the management of the governor, Pedro Bogar?n Vargas, commitments are being made to work together for road integration that guarantees greater economic dynamism. He also thanked the entire technical team, authorities and population in general for their willingness to work. "We are working to improve its roads and thus improve the quality of life of the entire San Martin population," he added.

It is necessary to mention that the pool of PEAM machinery, which carries out the work in this sector, is made up of an excavator, a caterpillar tractor, a roller tractor and four dump trucks; while the fuel supply is guaranteed in coordination with the Provincial Municipality of Moyobamba, the District Municipality of Soritor and the population, in this way efforts are joined for the benefit of the inhabitants of this area.
